intro: Podonosma galalensis, commonly known as the Galala thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and opposite, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Podonosma galalensis is often found in rocky habitats and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
